DOC.HEADLINE: China's first underground inter-city metro line starts trial run ahead of Asian Games

TEXT.P: China's first underground inter- city metro line, the Guangzhou-Foshan Metro Line (GFML) in south China's Guangdong Province, kicked off a trial run Thursday, said an official of Guangzhou Metro Corporation(GMC).
The 21-kilometer line, connecting Foshan City and the provincial capital Guangzhou, has 14 stations including -- 11 in Foshan and three in Guangzhou.
The line will officially start operating on November 3, nine days before the 16th Asian Games in Guangzhou.
More than 80 percent of the Asian Games venues will be accessible by metro lines and inter-city tracks between the two cities.

Passengers will be able to change the metro line between two cities without changing their tickets, as the GFML will be connected with Guangzhou's metro network. Public transport tickets from both Guangzhou and Foshan will be accepted on the metro line.
A total of 60,000 free tickets were distributed to local residents Thursday to encourage them to experience the new railway line.

"It used to take more than one hour from Foshan to Guangzhou by bus and cost me ten yuan (about 1.5 U.S. dollars). Now it will take only half an hour and cost me six yuan," said Rong Guobao, a resident in Foshan.

"The new line feels smoother and more comfortable than other metro lines. Its design is more passenger-oriented. It will be much more convenient for me to travel to Foshan," a passenger surnamed Chen said.
